about_etaps.description: ETAPS is a primary forum for academic and industrial researchers working on topics relating to software science.
notes: ETAPS is one of the world's leading fora for research on software science, with a history of more than 25 years.
The proceedings of ETAPS appear in gold open access, with no article processing charge for the authors specifically.
All constituent conferences provide artifact evaluation (AE).
Activities include a blog on software science, a PhD workshop, sessions on diversity and inclusion, and an ask-me-anything session.
Poster and Tool demo sessions are organized over the week.
Spin Symposium and Rust Verification Workshop are colocated with ETAPS again.

changes: Submission deadlines are strict and firm, no exceptions will be granted.
FoSSaCS 2026 will adopt a double-blind reviewing process.
PC members of FoSSaCS allowed to submit up to one paper to FoSSaCS with a higher acceptance threshold.

conferences.name: FASE
pc_chairs: Elvira Albert, Complutense University of Madrid

conferences.name: FoSSaCS
conferences.description: Foundations of Software Science and Computation Structures
conferences.ae_chair: Guillermo Alberto Perez, University of Antwerp

conferences.name: TACAS
conferences.description: Tools and Algorithms for the Construction and Analysis of Systems
ae_chairs: Matthias Volk, Eindhoven University of Technology

important_dates.event: Submission deadline for TACAS, FoSSaCS, FASE
TACAS mandatory artifact submission deadline (for tools)
Paper notification and TACAS mandatory artifact notification
Artifact submission deadline for accepted papers (except for TACAS tools)
Artifact notification ESOP, FASE, FoSSaCS, TACAS (voluntary artifacts)

publication.description: The proceedings will be published in the Advanced Research in Computing and Software Science (ARCoSS) subline of Springer's LNCS series.
notes: Proceedings volumes will appear in gold open access, so published versions of all papers will be available for free download.
The copyright of the papers will remain with the authors.

distinguished_papers.description: The strongest papers from the four conferences will be marked as distinguished.

etaps_test_of_time_award.description: Recognizes outstanding papers published at ETAPS more than ten years in the past.

etaps_rance_cleaveland_test_of_time_tool.description: Acknowledges the importance of reliable and well-maintained research tools.

doctoral_dissertation_award.description: Promotes and recognizes an outstanding dissertation in the research areas covered by the four main ETAPS conferences.

submission_instructions.description: The four main conferences of ETAPS 2026 solicit contributions of different types.

details.notes: Submitted research papers may be formatted in other formats.

submission_types.type: new ideas and emerging results (NIER) papers

submission_conditions: Papers must be in English, presenting original research.
Papers must be unpublished and not submitted for publication elsewhere.
Simultaneous submission of the same contribution to multiple ETAPS conferences is forbidden.
Submissions must follow the formatting guidelines of Springer's LNCS.
submission_instructions.review_process: ETAPS conferences will use double-blind reviewing (for regular research papers). Authors should omit names and institutions.

notes: Regular tool paper and tool demonstration paper submissions to TACAS must be accompanied by an artifact.
For research paper submissions at TACAS, participation in artifact evaluation is voluntary.
ESOP, FASE, and FoSSaCS will accept artifact submissions, participation is voluntary, and outcomes will not alter paper acceptance.

satellite_events.description: Several satellite workshops and other events will take place during the weekend before the main conferences.

organizer.name: University of Turin
organizer.description: Centre coordinating research, teaching, dissemination and technological transfer in Computer Science.

city_highlights: Technology hub with a startup community
